gurmukhi: ਗਨ ਰਤਨ ਗਨੳੁ ੳੁਪਰਤਨ ਅਬੈ || ਤੁਮ ਸੰਤ ਸੁਨੋ ਚਿਤ ਲਾੲਿ ਸਭੈ ||੫||
transliteration: Gad Ratan Gadau Oupratan Abai|| Toum Sant Souno Chit Laae Sabhai||5||
translation: After reckoning the jewels, now I mention the minor jewels, O saints; listen to me attentively.5.

gurmukhi: ਗਨ ਜੋਕ ਹਰੀਤਕੀ ਓਰ ਮਧੰ || ਜਨ ਪੰਚ ਸੁ ਨਾਮਯ ਸੰਖ ਸੁਭੰ ||
transliteration: Gad Jok Dareetakior Madhan Jan Panch Su Naamay Sankh Soubhan||
translation: These minor jewels are leech, myrobalan, honey, conch ( panchjanay), ruta, hemp, discus and mace;

gurmukhi: ਸਸ ਬੇਲ ਬਿਜਿਯਾ ਅਰ ਚੱਕ੍ਰ ਗਦਾ || ਜੁਵਰਾਜ ਬਿਰਾਜਤ ਪਾਨ ਸਦਾ ||੬||
transliteration: Sas Bel Bijiyaa Ar Chakkra Gadaa|| Juvraaj Biraajat Paan Sadaa||6||
translation: The later two look impressive in the hands of princes always.6.

gurmukhi: ਧਨੁ ਸਾਰੰਗ ਨੰਦਗ ਖੱਗ ਭਣੰ || ਜਿਨ ਖੰਡਿ ਕਰੈ ਗਨ ਦੲੀਤ ਰਣੰ ||
transliteration: Dhan(u) Saaran Nandag Khagg Bhanan|| Jin Khand(i) Darai Gad Daeet Ranan||
translation: The bow and arrow, the bull Nandi and the dagger (which had destroyed the demons) came out of the ocean.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਸੂਲ ਬੜਵਾਨਲ ਕਪਲ ਮੁਨੰ || ਤ ਧਨੰਤਰ ਚੳੁਦਸਵੋ ਰਤਨੰ ||੭||
transliteration: Siv Sool Batvaanal Kapal Mounndng|| Ta Dhanantar Chaudasvo Ratanan||7||
translation: The trident of Shiva, Barvanal (the fire), Kapil Muni and Dhanwantri came out as the fourteenth jewel.7.

gurmukhi: ਗਨ ਰਤਨ ੳੁਪਰਤਨ ਅੌ ਧਾਤ ਗਨੋ || ਕਹਿ ਧਾਤ ਸਭੈ ੳੁਪਧਾਤ ਭਨੋ ||
transliteration: Gad Ratan Oupratan Au Dhaat Gado|| Kah(i) Dhaat Sabhai Oupdhaat Bhano||
translation: After counting the greater and minor jewels, now I count the metals and afterwards I shall count the lesser metals.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਨਾਮ ਜਥਾ ਮਤ ਸਯਾਮ ਧਰੋ || ਘਟ ਜਾਨ ਕਵੀ ਜਿਨ ਨਿੰਦ ਕਰੋ ||੮||
transliteration: Sabh Naam Jathaa Mat Syaam Daro|| Ghat Jaan Kavijin Ninddaro||8||
translation: All these names have been reckoned by the poet Shyam according to his own understanding; considering them in small number, poets requested not to slander me.8.

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰਿਥਮੋ ਗਨ ਲੋਹ ਸਿਕਾ ਸ੍ਵਰਨੰ || ਚਤੁਰਥ ਭਨ ਧਾਤ ਸਿਤੰ ਰੁਕਮੰ ||
transliteration: Prithmo Gad Loh Sikaa Svaranan|| Chaturath Bhan Dhaa; Sitan Roukamannd||
translation: First of tall I reckon iron, lead and gold alongwith the fourth white metal silver;

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁਰੋ ਕਥ ਤਾਂਬਰ ਕਲੀ ਪਿਤਰੰ || ਕਥਿ ਅਸਟਮ ਜਿਸਤੁ ਹੈ ਧਾਤ ਧਰੰ ||੯||
transliteration: Bahuro Kath Taanbar Kalipikran|| Kath(i) Astam Jist(u) Hai Dhaat Dharan||9||
translation: Then mentioning copper, tin and brass, I consider the eighth metal as zinc, which is found within the earth.9.
